product_name: Cosrx Salicylic Acid Daily Gentle Cleanser
price_size: Varies but less than â‚±300 for 150ml when you get it on discount (online)!
effects: Have been using this for around 4-5 years and this helped remove excess sebum talaga. Controlled my oil, helped with breakouts, gentle and very low % of salicylic so for everyday talaga. This is a very well known product that I assume has been tried by many, but still want to recommend it because itâ€™s that effective. My first korean product and I still love it to this day! Disclaimer: this is more for oily/combi skin. Dry skin is not hiyang with this I think.

effects: My mistake buying the 10% right off the bat ðŸ’€ðŸ’€. I borrowed my momâ€™s 10% panoxyl benzoyl p. wash before and now that I moved out i ordered my own and bought the 10% na agad figuring that i can tolerate it naman na. When it arrived, thatâ€™s when i realized na fake pala gamit ng nanay ko and damn this stings so muchhh. I tried applying it every other day the first few weeks and minsan parang spot treatment lang, like ibababad ko one thick layer of wash sa active pimple ko for 1-3 mins bc i felt like the rest of my face couldnâ€™t take the whole product. It works SO FAST. Literal parang kusa na lang nagpupush out yung pus palabas as iâ€™m washing it off. Then I slap a pimple patch pag di pa completely natanggal yung pus. Perfect combination. Now I use it once a day and apply it to the T-zone since dun lang naman ako tinitigyawat at pansin ko ang galing din niya magexfoliate. Even more effective than the two salicylic products i bought from Cosrx and Skintific. So now I donâ€™t use them anymore, just this panoxyl wash na lang. So yeah siguro advice ko na lang na stick to the 4% concentration if mild-mod acne lang naman and it would work just as well. Otherwise, this product is so good, it killed all my active pimples, prevented future breakouts and works as an exfoliator for me din. HG MATERIAL ðŸ‘‘ðŸ‘‘ðŸ‘‘

Order: First
Type: gel
Price/Quantity: 250 pesos/one 120 mL
Effect/experience: I think this is my fave gentle cleanser na pasok sa budget ko. Itâ€™s not stripping and i still feel my natural oils retained after washing with it. Itâ€™s best used lalo na after oil cleansing and right before using tretinoin because safe siya sa barrier ko. I love it lol.

Product Name: PanOxyl 10% Benzoyl Peroxide Acne foaming wash
Order: First
Type: cream
Price/Quantity: 950 pesos/156 mL
Effect/experience: My mistake buying the 10% right off the bat ðŸ’€ðŸ’€. I borrowed my momâ€™s 10% panoxyl benzoyl p. wash before and now that I moved out i ordered my own and bought the 10% na agad figuring that i can tolerate it naman na. When it arrived, thatâ€™s when i realized na fake pala gamit ng nanay ko and damn this stings so muchhh.
I tried applying it every other day the first few weeks and minsan parang spot treatment lang, like ibababad ko one thick layer of wash sa active pimple ko for 1-3 mins bc i felt like the rest of my face couldnâ€™t take the whole product. It works SO FAST. Literal parang kusa na lang nagpupush out yung pus palabas as iâ€™m washing it off. Then I slap a pimple patch pag di pa completely natanggal yung pus. Perfect combination.
Now I use it once a day and apply it to the T-zone since dun lang naman ako tinitigyawat at pansin ko ang galing din niya magexfoliate. Even more effective than the two salicylic products i bought from Cosrx and Skintific. So now I donâ€™t use them anymore, just this panoxyl wash na lang.
So yeah siguro advice ko na lang na stick to the 4% concentration if mild-mod acne lang naman and it would work just as well. Otherwise, this product is so good, it killed all my active pimples, prevented future breakouts and works as an exfoliator for me din. HG MATERIAL ðŸ‘‘ðŸ‘‘ðŸ‘‘

price_size: smallest is around 300 for 118mls, or around 500 for 250 mls.
effects: i used to only use Cerave but it's hard to source. Found Cetaphil and it suits me just fine plus it's way cheaper. This cleanser is mild and inoffensive. Perfect especially if like me you use actives in other parts of your routine (vit c, acids, retinol). This doesn't overwhelm my skin, not drying.
comment:
Skin Type: oily combo sa pinas. Dry combo colder climates. No acne / clear skin, occasional pimples lang once in a blue moon.
Product Name: Cetaphil Gentle Skin cleanser (blue cap)
Order: Second if I use an oil cleanser. OK sya as only cleanser if you don't wear makeup.
Type: liquid
Price/Quantity: smallest is around 300 for 118mls, or around 500 for 250 mls.
Effect/experience: i used to only use Cerave but it's hard to source. Found Cetaphil and it suits me just fine plus it's way cheaper. This cleanser is mild and inoffensive. Perfect especially if like me you use actives in other parts of your routine (vit c, acids, retinol). This doesn't overwhelm my skin, not drying.
Status: WR, HG

product_name: Luxe Organix's Aqua Lock hydrogel cleanser
price_size: 122php for 20mL (repackaged yung naorder ko cause it seems to be discontinued. details below)
effects: just a bit of context. i tried to search up on youtube some anti-aging regimen recommendations and ito yung narecommend ni Jan Angelo from YT. so far I've used a 20mL variant and it's been great. It's gentle on the skin and has a nice soothing effect. very relaxing and its reminiscent of the milk cleanser from DermaBlend i used to use.
